qas.question: What rebellion began in January of 2012?
In March of 2012 whom gained control of Mali?
What group led the rebellion in Northern Mali?

answers.text: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad

qas.question: The embargo of the Economic Community of West African States imposed what type of punishment?
What group declared independence as Asawad?
What rebellion began in South Mali?
The Tuareg rebellion began in June of what year?
What Islamic group led the rebellion in North Mali?
Who did AQIM Institute sanctions against?
Who did the MNLA turn against?

context: In January <b6_0>2012<b6_0/> a <a0_0><b5_0>Tuareg rebellion<b5_0/><a0_0/> began in Northern Mali, led by the <a2_0>National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad<a2_0/>. In March, military officer <a1_0><b8_0>Amadou Sanogo<b8_0/><a1_0/> seized power in a coup d'état, citing Touré's failures in quelling the rebellion, and leading to <a3_0>sanctions<a3_0/> and an embargo by the Economic Community of West African States. The <a4_0>MNLA<a4_0/> quickly took control of the north, declaring independence as Azawad. However, Islamist groups including <b7_0>Ansar Dine<b7_0/> and Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM), who had helped the MNLA defeat the government, turned on the <b9_0>Tuareg<b9_0/> and took control of the North with the goal of implementing sharia in Mali.
